Data types

ciocol_t

Summary

An enumerator containing available console output colour options. This type is separately provided by <cioenum.h>.

Enumerator values

  • CIOCOL_BLACK
  • CIOCOL_DKBLUE
  • CIOCOL_DKGREEN
  • CIOCOL_LTBLUE
  • CIOCOL_DKRED
  • CIOCOL_MAGENTA
  • CIOCOL_ORANGE
  • CIOCOL_LTGREY
  • CIOCOL_GREY
  • CIOCOL_BLUE
  • CIOCOL_GREEN
  • CIOCOL_CYAN
  • CIOCOL_RED
  • CIOCOL_PINK
  • CIOCOL_YELLOW
  • CIOCOL_WHITE

ciocolbuf_t

Members

  • code colour code for UNIX systems.

Summary

A buffer structure to hold a console colour code string. This structure is used to return console colour codes as strings from functions such as ciocol().

Output colourisation

ciocolbuf_t ciocol(uint8_t fg, uint8_t bg)

Arguments

  • fg foreground colour (either integer or ciocol_t enum).
  • bg background colour (either integer or ciocol_t enum).

Returns

  • A constant buffer structure with string containing a colour code.

Summary

For UNIX systems, return a ciocolbuf_t containing a string holding a colour code that can be printed to an output stream to set the following output colour. For Windows systems, set the current state output colour, and return with an empty string.

Pass 0xFF to fg or bg to skip that colour value.

ciocolbuf_t ciocoldef()

Returns

  • A constant buffer structure with string containing a colour code.

Summary

For UNIX systems, return a ciocolbuf_t containing a string holding a colour code that can be printed to an output stream to set the following output colour. For Windows systems, set the current state output colour, and return with an empty string.

The returned colour code/state update on Windows is the default console output colour.

void ciocolstateset(uint8_t fg, uint8_t bg, FILE *stream)

Arguments

  • fg foreground colour (either integer or ciocol_t enum).
  • bg background colour (either integer or ciocol_t enum).
  • stream NULL (defaults to stdout) or the stream for which to set the output colour.

Summary

Update the colour used by the terminal emulator for output when writing to the specified stream.

Pass 0xFF to fg or bg to skip updating that colour value. If both parameters are specified as 0xff, nothing will happen.

void ciocolstatedef(FILE *stream)

Arguments

  • stream NULL (defaults to stdout) or the stream for which to set the output colour.

Summary

Set the colour of the output sent to the specified stream to the default value.
